Game.blocks

Class BlocksType

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.blocks.BlocksType

  • public class BlocksType
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class is to be used as a superclass that stores templates, similar to WeaponsEnum in netspace.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float bouncyness
      This variable will store the block's bouncyness/restitution.

      This variable will store the height of the block to be made.

      This variable will store a fixture's x rotation.

      This variable will store the size (height and width) of a tile.

      BlocksType(int e, float xPos, float yPos, int s, float rx)

    • Field Detail

      • xPosition

        public float xPosition
        This variable will store the x coordinate of the block to be made.

      • yPosition

        public float yPosition
        This variable will store the y cooridnate of the block to be made.

      • size

        public int size
        This variable will store the size (height and width) of a tile.

      • w

        public float w
        This variable will store the width of the block to be made.

      • h

        public float h
        This variable will store the height of the block to be made.

      • density

        public float density
        This variable will store the block's density. A normal wooden block has a density of 1f.

      • friction

        public float friction
        This variable will store the block's friction. This value should be between 0 and 1.

      • bouncyness

        public float bouncyness
        This variable will store the block's bouncyness/restitution. A value of 0 means that things do not bounce. A value of 1 means that things bounce back to the height they fell from.

      • rx

        public float rx
        This variable will store a fixture's x rotation.

      • t

        public org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyType t
        This variable will store the block's BodyType. It will be either Static or Dynamic. Static blocks are unaffected by gravity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlocksType

        public BlocksType(int e,
          float xPos,
          float yPos,
          int s,
          float rx)
        The integer e determines the type of block to be made. If e is zero, a static wall block will be made. If e is 1, a dynamic wall block will be made. If e is 2, a static ice block will be made. If e is 3, a static trampoline block will be made. If e is 4, a dynamic ice block will be made. If e is 5, a dynamic trampoline block will be made. If e is 6, a dynamic heavy block will be made.
